Title:
In vitro alpha-glucosidase inhibition, antimicrobial and
cytotoxic activities of extracts from endophytic fungus, Nigrospora
sphaerica isolated from Helianthus annuus
Keywords:
Antimicrobial activity, Alpha-glucosidase inhibition,
Endophytic fungi
Abstract:
This study aims to evaluate alpha-glucosidase inhibition
and antimicrobial activity as well as cytotoxic activity of extracts
from endophytic fungus, Nigrospora sphaerica obtained from leaves of
Helianthus annuus, which widely cultivated for food and used as
medicinal plant. This fungus was cultivated in PDB for three weeks.
After that, it was harvested and extracted with hexane, ethyl acetate
and methanol. Three crude extracts were obtained from the extraction
process, including ethyl acetate partition extract (CE) from mycelia,
methanol partition extract (CM) from mycelia and ethyl acetate partition
extract (BE) from fermentation broth. The extracts were assayed for
inhibition of alpha-glucosidase, antimicrobial activity against
pathogenic microorganisms and cytotoxic activity against cell lines
based on colorimetric assays. The endophytic extract (BE) showed the
significantly against Gram-positive bacteria with MIC values range of
16-32 µg/mL (Staphylococcus aureus and methicillin-resistant S. aureus)
and few yeasts (Candida albicans) with MIC values range of 64-128 µg/mL,
especially, filamentous fungi (Talaromyces marneffei) with MIC value at
4 µg/mL. The best antimicrobial activity of extract (BE) was observed
and confirmed by SEM. The inhibitory concentration (IC50) of active
extract from alpha-glucosidase inhibition were recorded as 21.17 µg/mL
and was also showed the significant cytotoxicity activity against A549
cancer human cell lines. In addition, this crude extract was analyzed by
using gas chromatography-mass spectrometry (GC-MS) into three main
compounds, including 2-phenylacetic acid, 5-pentyldihydrofuran-2(3H)-one
and (Z)-methyl 4-(isobutyryloxy)but-3-enoate. In conclusion, endophytic
fungus, Nigrospora sphaerica is the potential source of active
metabolites, which showed broad spectrum of antimicrobial activity and
alpha-glucosidase inhibition, as well as gave cytotoxicity against A549
cell lines.
